title: Hello, Moto, And Massive Phone Discounts On This Fine Prime Day
description: Need a new foldable or a regular phone? Motorola's Prime Days make it possible to buy one under $1000.
author: Irene Okpanachi
excerpt: Need a new foldable or a regular phone? Motorola's Prime Days make it possible to buy one under $1000.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. Motorola may not have the best software support, and I'll probably never get tired of stressing that. But they do have great hardware quality, and they're arguably in a league of their own, especially when it comes to hinges. There's a clear distinction between their phones and the rest of the Android devices. With Prime Day officially live, you can finally grab their devices at reasonable prices. If you're ready to upgrade your phone or need a backup, here are the best deals available. Razr-sharp savings on this popular foldable Image: Talk Android / Amazon Moto’s 2024 models present massive external display and quality hinge design that competes directly with Samsung’s Z Flip phones. Although the 2025 series is out now, the spotlight is on the Razr+ 2024. It has left an intimidating $1000 price mark to the same value of an upper midrange phone. That’s less than half its original price, and a big statement about how Motorola is positioning this foldable for mass appeal. The phone comes with a 4-inch external AMOLED display with full app support when closed, and a 165Hz foldable LTPO AMOLED inner display. It also uses the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3, and 45W fast charging on a 4,000mAh battery. Original pricePrime Day priceDiscount$1,000$700$300 off Even cheaper deals on this everyday model Image: Talk Android / Amazon As the name implies, the Moto G Stylus 2025 has a stylus. Usually, this is Samsung's lane because few manufacturers get styluses right like them. Although Motorola’s pens are nowhere near the same level of precision, pressure sensitivity, and app ecosystem, they're less costly and great performers. This year's G Stylus 5G phone has a 6.7-inch AMOLED display with a 1220 x 2712 resolution, 120Hz refresh rate, HDR support, and up to 3000 nits peak brightness. Powering it is the Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 chip, paired with 8GB RAM and up to 256GB storage, expandable via microSD. It’s IP68 water and dust resistant with a 5000mAh battery that supports 68W fast charging. Original pricePrime Day priceDiscount$400$360$40 off Live on the edge of great value under $400  Image: Talk Android / Amazon Motorola’s Edge+ 2023 launched at nearly $800 and is down to half that price at $400. Frankly, it's the more conventional smartphone experience compared to even the Razr+ (2024). The gap between them isn’t as wide as the price difference suggests. The Edge+ has a curved 6.67-inch OLED display, Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset, a 5100mAh battery with 68W fast charging, and other features that put the foldable to shame. It also carries a triple camera setup and Gorilla Glass Victus on both sides. Original pricePrime Day priceDiscount$800$400$400 off Dial into more discounts with Amazon Manufacturers have plenty of phone discounts for Prime Day. We've only handpicked the top options from Motorola. But you obviously won't spend all your money on mobile devices and call it a day. The limited event is offering you a chance to upgrade the rest of your home setup too. There are fast chargers, smart lights, paper-like Android tablets, and even smart watches for your kids to take advantage of. Irene is an experienced writer with five years' experience in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

Motorola may not have the best software support, and I'll probably never get tired of stressing that. But they do have great hardware quality, and they're arguably in a league of their own, especially when it comes to hinges. There's a clear distinction between their phones and the rest of the Android devices. With Prime Day officially live, you can finally grab their devices at reasonable prices. If you're ready to upgrade your phone or need a backup, here are the best deals available.

Razr-sharp savings on this popular foldable

Moto’s 2024 models present massive external display and quality hinge design that competes directly with Samsung’s Z Flip phones. Although the 2025 series is out now, the spotlight is on the Razr+ 2024. It has left an intimidating $1000 price mark to the same value of an upper midrange phone. That’s less than half its original price, and a big statement about how Motorola is positioning this foldable for mass appeal. The phone comes with a 4-inch external AMOLED display with full app support when closed, and a 165Hz foldable LTPO AMOLED inner display. It also uses the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3, and 45W fast charging on a 4,000mAh battery.

Even cheaper deals on this everyday model

As the name implies, the Moto G Stylus 2025 has a stylus. Usually, this is Samsung's lane because few manufacturers get styluses right like them. Although Motorola’s pens are nowhere near the same level of precision, pressure sensitivity, and app ecosystem, they're less costly and great performers. This year's G Stylus 5G phone has a 6.7-inch AMOLED display with a 1220 x 2712 resolution, 120Hz refresh rate, HDR support, and up to 3000 nits peak brightness. Powering it is the Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 chip, paired with 8GB RAM and up to 256GB storage, expandable via microSD. It’s IP68 water and dust resistant with a 5000mAh battery that supports 68W fast charging.

Live on the edge of great value under $400 

Motorola’s Edge+ 2023 launched at nearly $800 and is down to half that price at $400. Frankly, it's the more conventional smartphone experience compared to even the Razr+ (2024). The gap between them isn’t as wide as the price difference suggests. The Edge+ has a curved 6.67-inch OLED display, Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset, a 5100mAh battery with 68W fast charging, and other features that put the foldable to shame. It also carries a triple camera setup and Gorilla Glass Victus on both sides.

Dial into more discounts with Amazon

Manufacturers have plenty of phone discounts for Prime Day. We've only handpicked the top options from Motorola. But you obviously won't spend all your money on mobile devices and call it a day. The limited event is offering you a chance to upgrade the rest of your home setup too. There are fast chargers, smart lights, paper-like Android tablets, and even smart watches for your kids to take advantage of.

Irene is an experienced writer with five years' experience in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating.
